sune.ssp

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • sune.ssp.Client
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SecureClient

    public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents simple and not secured client that is using SSP (Sune's Simple Protocol). It provides default communication with a server and basic functionality, such as sending/receiving data and sending/receiving files.
    Since:
    alpha v0.1-pre1
    Author:
    Sune

    • Method Detail

      • setPromptToReceiveFile

        public void setPromptToReceiveFile(boolean value)
        Sets whether the prompt to receive a file should be shown or not.
        Parameters:
        value - If true, listeners of #registryPromptReceiveFile() are called when a file is sent to this client, otherwise not.

      • setBufferSize

        public void setBufferSize(int size)
        Sets size of buffer that is used when sending a file.
        Parameters:
        size - New size of the buffer. Default is 8192.

      • setMaxSendTransfers

        public void setMaxSendTransfers(int max)
        Sets the maximum amount of file-send transfers.
        Parameters:
        max - New maximum amount of file-send transfers. Default is 5.

      • create

        public static Client create(java.lang.String serverIP,
                            int serverPort)
        Creates a client with information for future establishing a connection with the server specified by its IP address and its port.
        Parameters:
        serverIP - The server IP address
        serverPort - The server port
        Returns:
        Created client object. Call connect() to connect the client to the specified server.
